name: 1-benzyloxy-3-iodobenzene
Reason: 1-benzyloxy-3-iodobenzene has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The introduction of a benzyl group (–C(=C)–) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The iodine atom (I) raises the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10°C. The methyl group (–CH3) reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and the absence of a hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around -5°C. The iodine atom (I) raises the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10°C.
